article.title: A representative survey of the dynamics and energetics of FRII radio galaxies

multiple_choice_question.text: What does Figure 1 tell us about the magnetic field strength in FRII radio lobes compared to the equipartition value?
choices: The observed magnetic field strength is higher than the equipartition value for most sources.
The observed magnetic field strength is lower than the equipartition value for all sources.
The observed magnetic field strength is equal to the equipartition value for all sources.
There is no clear trend between the observed and equipartition magnetic field strengths.

multiple_choice_question.text: What does Figure 2 show about the internal energy of FRII radio lobes compared to the equipartition value?
choices: The observed internal energy is lower than the equipartition value for all sources.
The observed internal energy is higher than the equipartition value for all sources.
The observed internal energy is equal to the equipartition value for most sources.
There is no clear trend between the observed and equipartition internal energies.

multiple_choice_question.text: In Figure 3, what does the dotted line represent, and how are most lobes positioned relative to it at mid-lobe?
choices: The dotted line represents pressure imbalance, and most lobes are located above it at mid-lobe.
The dotted line represents pressure balance, and most lobes are located below it at mid-lobe.
The dotted line represents pressure imbalance, and most lobes are located below it at mid-lobe.
The dotted line represents pressure balance, and most lobes are located near it at mid-lobe.

multiple_choice_question.text: Based on Formula (1), what parameters are used to calculate the Mach number (M) of an FRII radio lobe tip?
choices: Adiabatic index (Γ), internal lobe pressure (Pi), and external lobe pressure (Po).
Internal lobe energy (Ei), jet age (τ), and speed of sound in the ICM (cs).
Radio luminosity (L), jet power (Qjet), and redshift (z).
